ca.mcgill.ecse211.odometry

Class LightCorrection

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • ca.mcgill.ecse211.odometry.LightCorrection
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class LightCorrection
extends java.lang.Thread
    Use the two light sensors in the back to correct drive the robot in a straight line.
    Since:
    2.0
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Team 2

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        Do light correction. Drive until a line is detected, then make sure both sensors are on a line, if not then rotate until both sensors are on a line.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread

      • preCorrection

        private void preCorrection()
        Setup before the correction. Stop the robot and set the speed to rotate speed.

      • postCorrection

        private void postCorrection()
        Finalize after correction. Take a break, and then continue driving.

      • takeBreak

        private void takeBreak(int milliseconds)
        Sleep the thread for a set amount of milliseconds
        Parameters:
        milliseconds - how many milliseconds to sleep the thread for

      • getDiffTheta

        private double getDiffTheta(double oldTheta,
                            double newTheta)
        Get the difference of two angles
        Parameters:
        oldTheta - first angle
        newTheta - second angle
        Returns:
        difference between oldTheta and newTheta
